newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium to issue September state notes at par.
newsitem.headline: Belgium to issue September state notes at par.

text.p: The Belgian treasury said on Friday the country's next September 18 issue of medium term state notes would be priced at par.
The Treasury is offering two notes. The first carries a coupon of 5.45 percent for the first five years until 2001, and can be extended for another two years until September 17, 2003.

The second carries minimum guaranteed coupons revisable after three, five and seven years. The guaranteed minimum coupons are respectively 4.50, 5.50 and 6.00 percent. The coupons will rise if, at pre-set dates, the market yields on similar dated government linear bonds (OLOs) are higher.
Retail investors only can subscribe to the notes between September 11 and 17. -- Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6810
